data.text: A Question of Top Dry Bags: What Bag and Straps?
For those with a rear rack/ TOP drybag set up (i.e. not sidebags), what bag and straps do you use?
Ortlieb Backrollers.
data.author: Eric Knudstrup

data.text: NOT panniers, he was specific.
data.author: Josh Kebschull

data.text: I've never seen them called "side bags" before.
data.author: Eric Knudstrup

data.text: he said TOP drybags....not side bags...regardless if the word "sidebags" is a thing, he says "not" which = excludes.
data.author: Josh Kebschull

data.text: the only thing better than my Ortlieb Backrollers are the Ortlieb air tight bags. I also have a set of front panniers I got from REI almost 15 years ago which are air tight, but discontinued long ago. I have a large Ortlieb triangle bag that won't fit on my frame that I might be willing to negotiate on.
data.author: Eric Knudstrup

data.text: ultra light travelers might like the Ortlieb handlebar bag. I put my hammock, rain cover, and hammock tackle in it. I also recommend their triangle bag. *Air tight*.
data.author: Eric Knudstrup

data.text: I have the QR bikepacking version...the one that attaches with cords around the stem/handlebar
data.author: Josh Kebschull
Dan Bosch

data.text: Ortlieb dry bags.
data.author: Dan Bosch

data.text: Question not clear: Inquiring about a single top mounted bag setup
data.author: Tim Barber

data.text: You mean like this??? My rear rack is a Thule touring rack with sealline baja dry bag. (This is the biggest of the 2...I bought a 10L and 20L) The straps are the Voile XL 32 inch.
data.author: Matthew Harris

data.text: I imagine just voile straps and a 30l dry bag.
data.author: Dustin Schulten

data.text: There you go.
data.author: Scott Rasmussen

data.text: Voile - they're $$$ but sooooo worth it
data.author: Nick Neleht

data.text: Sea to Summit make great dry bags in numerous sizes and colors. Silicone straps like Voile are bombproof. They come in various lengths and colors. Several manufacturers make them.
data.author: Bill Dove

data.text: Voile straps are too heavy for me. I use nylon straps. Here is the three I use most. A couple 8 inch ones for my handlebar bag and a 36 inch one for whatever huge things I want to put on my rack. All three of these weigh significantly less than one 32 inch viole strap with a nylon buckle.
data.author: David Baker-Yuill

data.text: Here are the three straps in action. I use whichever stuff sack best suits my load in the back.
data.author: David Baker-Yuill

data.text: I’m curious about your front two bottle holders. Do you recall where you got them?
data.author: Clay Prosser

data.text:
These. The plastic clamps worried me but they have held up for a couple of years now. https://www.topeak.com/global/en/products/288-Bikepacking-Series/1129-VERSACAGE
VERSACAGE
topeak.com
data.author: David Baker-Yuill

data.text: thanks!
data.author: Clay Prosser

data.text: Check out Duzer’s rack setup at about the 2 minute mark maybe. https://youtu.be/YQhYjpOH1oM
data.author: Dean Wolfgang

data.text: 20L or whatever size Sea to Summit bag a couple of Voile straps and a Rockgeist bag protector. https://rockgeist.com/product/armadillo-dry-bag-protector/
data.author: Dean Wolfgang

data.text: Velcro or Gunt (voile copy) from Bunnings DIY in Aussie. $5 or so
data.author: Yin Yang Adventures

data.text: Lots of suggestions for Voile XL here (that's what I use too) and Voile even make a rack-specific strap, but another popular option is Rok straps. Popular with motorcycle travellers I believe. Pretty convenient to use and definitely worth consideration.
data.author: Dave Henderson

data.text:
Sea to Summit dry bag and Voile straps. Voile makes straps that will snap on to a pannier rack. Rockgeist also sells a hypalon sheet and matching drybag for this purpose. I have the hypalon sheet but I use a Sea to Summit bag. https://seatosummit.com/products/big-river-dry-bag
Big River Dry Bag | Sea to Summit
seatosummit.com
data.author: Douglas Miner

data.text: Another vote forel the Sea to Summit dry bags. Very durable. I have a waterproof compression version that is awesome.
data.author: Andy Lovell

data.text: Picked up a cheap 20L waterproof duffel on Amazon (Wild Heart) and sewed up some velcro straps, and attached with split rings to the bag's existing straps. It velcros easily to any rack, with the roll down strap securing it even further by running it under the rack as well
data.author: Mark Hohmann
Mark Hohmann
